activities.loc: JCB Check Monitor & Posted Calendar for Courtroom

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Sean M Herricks

records.addlTxt:
11:00 AM Defendant Sean M Herricks in court.  Attorney Alex Kitto in court for Sean M Herricks.  Prosecuting attorney John Michael O'Boyle in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Formal reading of Complaint waived.  Preliminary hearing waived.  Court questions Defendant. The Court finds waiver of Preliminary is knowingly, intelligently and voluntarily given, finds probable cause and bound over for trial.   Address confirmed and does not have a phone number.  Bail continues.
Arraignment scheduled for January 4, 2023 at 10:00 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
Defendant shall be fingerprinted at the Barron County Sheriff's Dept., if not already done.
If represented by the Public Defender and does not have a phone, must contact the Public Defender weekly at 715-908-8473.

1:23 PM Defendant Sean M Herricks appeared by video, in custody.  Prosecuting attorney Brian H. Wright Aty in court for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Alex Kitto appeared by video for Sean M Herricks, for today.  Court Reporter appeared by Zoom video means. 
DE needs to call and apply for PD. 
Next hearing to be in front of Judge Bitney, in person.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for October 19, 2022 at 10:00 am.
